SUMMARY: November 8, 2022

TITLE: Meet the team behind CNN's famous 'Magic Wall'
SUMMARY: CNN's John King has become synonymous with the "Magic Wall," a touchscreen display featuring a vast array of up-to-date voting data on election night. His incredibly fast-paced breakdown of that data and his breadth of knowledge across the political spectrum has gained the attention of many news organizations, fans on social media and even late-night hosts.

SUMMARY: The mayor of Kyiv has said the city "cannot let Putin steal our Christmas" as Ukrainians prepare to tentatively celebrate the festive season with darkened trees while Russian airstrikes knock out power and wreak havoc on critical infrastructure.

TITLE: Georgia Senate candidate Herschel Walker described himself as living in Texas during 2022 campaign speech

The plot might be an allegory for the movie itself, as well as its legacy, since some 35 years later, the relatively esoteric title is getting a brand new life by way of a big-budget fantasy series premiering this week on Disney+.

TITLE: Soaking up the atmosphere at Qatar 2022: What it's like at a 'dry' World Cup

TITLE: Inside Biden's calculated move to buck labor allies in hopes of averting a rail strike

TITLE: Georgia Senate candidate Herschel Walker described himself as living in Texas during 2022 campaign speech
SUMMARY: Georgia Republican Senate candidate Herschel Walker, facing renewed and growing questions about his residency in the final week of the runoff campaign, described himself during a campaign speech in January as living in Texas and said he decided to run for Georgia's Senate seat while at his Texas "home," according to a CNN KFile review of his campaign speeches.

TITLE: Jiang Zemin, former leader who paved the way for China's rise, dies age 96
SUMMARY: Jiang Zemin, the Chinese communist leader who paved the way for the country's emergence as a global superpower, has died, state-run Xinhua news agency announced Wednesday.

In the middle of the night, Tejeda watched Zoelis' chest tighten, and she knew she had to act. TITLE: Flu surged after Thanksgiving, as early season continues to worsen

TITLE: Israeli military admits shooting 16-year-old Palestinian girl, calls it 'unintentional'

TITLE: Screens may help distract a child from a tantrum, but they make another more likely, study shows
SUMMARY: For some kids, it feels like the only way to break through a difficult emotional period is with a show they love on TV or the internet. But screens used as a distraction from a tantrum may make it even harder to address the next time, a new study showed.

TITLE: Supreme Court agrees to hear another challenge to Biden's student loan forgiveness program and leaves program blocked
SUMMARY: The US Supreme Court announced on Monday that it will hold arguments in a second case in February concerning President Biden's student loan forgiveness program, which is currently on hold.

TITLE: Youngkin schedules February special election in Virginia to fill Donald McEachin's seat
SUMMARY: A special election in Virginia to replace the late Democratic Rep. Donald McEachin, who died last month, will take place in February, Gov. Glenn Youngkin announced Monday.

TITLE: Clumsy cub and smiling fish among Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards winning images
SUMMARY: An image of a 3-month-old lion cub falling out of a tree has been named the overall winner of this year's Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards.

TITLE: UN agency says Israel is delaying new visas for its staff
SUMMARY: A United Nations agency that operates in the West Bank and Gaza says Israel is not processing visas for its newly recruited staff, while Israeli officials accuse the agency of "ignoring Israeli victims of terror" in East Jerusalem and the occupied West Bank.

TITLE: CNN Poll: Americans are split over confidence in incoming House GOP majority or Biden
SUMMARY: Americans divide almost evenly over whether they have more confidence in the newly empowered Republicans in the US House of Representatives (51%) or in President Joe Biden (49%) to deal with the major issues facing the country today, according to a new CNN poll conducted by SSRS.

TITLE: It's not the most wonderful time of the year for markets. Here's why
SUMMARY: The holidays are meant to be the most wonderful time of the year. But for investors, this week just might be the most stressful time of the year.

TITLE: The Wall Street Journal names Emma Tucker its next editor, marking first woman to head the newspaper
SUMMARY: The Wall Street Journal on Monday named Emma Tucker as its next editor-in-chief, marking the first time the Rupert Murdoch-owned financial broadsheet will be headed by a woman.

TITLE: 5 things to know for December 12: Winter storm, NASA, Ukraine, World Cup, China
SUMMARY: Here's what else you need to know to Get Up to Speed and On with Your Day.

TITLE: Americans expect inflation to ease, Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Consumers are expecting inflation to improve in the coming months, according to new survey data from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

TITLE: Peru's new president rules out elections, as predecessor Castillo remains detained
SUMMARY: Peru's new President Dina Boluarte ruled out early elections on Thursday, her first day in office following the dramatic ousting and arrest of her predecessor Pedro Castillo.

TITLE: Janet Yellen: Inflation will be 'much lower' by the end of 2023 and a recession isn't required
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is striking a cautiously optimistic tone about 2023, predicting a major inflation cooldown and stressing that a recession isn't required to get prices back under control.

TITLE: Ukrainian strikes killed 'dozens' in Russian-occupied Melitopol, exiled mayor says
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces struck the Russian-occupied city of Melitopol over the weekend, opening a new front in Kyiv's fight to reclaim land in the south of the country and underlining the importance of longer-range weaponry.

TITLE: Greene again downplays Capitol riot and says it would have been armed if she led it
SUMMARY: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene said over the weekend that if she had led the January 6, 2021, insurrection at the US Capitol that "we would have won" and that people would have been "armed."

TITLE: Body of Zambian national killed fighting in Ukraine returns home
SUMMARY: The body of Lemekani Nathan Nyirenda, a fighter recruited by the mercenary group Wagner for combat operations in Ukraine, was returned to Zambia on Sunday.

TITLE: Two sisters just reunited with the mystery woman who gave them $100 on a plane 23 years ago
SUMMARY: It took decades for two refugee sisters to find the mystery woman who gave them $100 on a plane the day they first arrived in the US. Reuniting with her was even more powerful than they'd imagined.

TITLE: Everything you need to know about Biden's student loan forgiveness program
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden's federal student loan forgiveness program, which promises to deliver up to $20,000 of debt relief for millions of borrowers, is on hold indefinitely as legal challenges work their way through the courts.

TITLE: Giving your child a screen may hinder emotional regulation, study says. Here's what to do instead
SUMMARY: For some kids, it feels like the only way to break through a difficult emotional period is with a show they love on TV or the internet. But screens used as a distraction from a tantrum may make it even harder to address the next time, a new study showed.

TITLE: Hiker falls 300 feet to his death off the summit of New Hampshire's Mt. Willard
SUMMARY: A man hiking near the summit of Mt. Willard in New Hampshire fell 300 feet to his death, authorities said.

TITLE: Opinion: Gadhafi's agents thought they'd get away with the Lockerbie bombing. They were wrong
SUMMARY: Almost three and half decades since Pan Am flight 103 was brought down, killing 270 people, US officials have arrested one of the authors of the deadly attack, which was carried out by Moammar Gadhafi and his intelligence officials. Peter Bergen explains how and why the alleged perpetrators were caught.

TITLE: A Los Angeles jury is deliberating for a 7th day in Harvey Weinstein's 2nd sexual assault trial
SUMMARY: A Los Angeles jury returned Monday to continue deliberations in the second sexual assault trial of Harvey Weinstein, the disgraced movie mogul accused of using his Hollywood influence to lure women into private meetings and assault them.

TITLE: Brittney Griner is back in the US and dunking again after almost 10 months detained in Russia
SUMMARY: Fresh off her elated return to the US after months in Russian custody, Olympic gold medalist Brittney Griner is back on a basketball court.

TITLE: Former officer who killed Atatiana Jefferson testifies she pointed a gun at him before he fired
SUMMARY: The former Fort Worth police officer charged with murder for the 2019 shooting of 28-year-old Atatiana Jefferson in her own home testified Monday he fired at her because he saw her point her gun at him.

TITLE: A mom of five killed by the KKK was among the civil rights 'martyrs' Warnock named in his victory speech
SUMMARY: Sen. Raphael Warnock's re-election is being celebrated by supporters across the nation with many political observers crediting the work of voting rights groups for the consequential win.

TITLE: Biden administration officials meet virtually with Paul Whelan's sister
SUMMARY: Biden administration officials met virtually on Monday with Elizabeth Whelan, whose brother Paul Whelan remains detained in Russia, she told CNN.

TITLE: With 'Top Gun' and 'Avatar,' the Golden Globes point the way for the Oscars
SUMMARY: The cliché about award shows is that it's an honor just to be nominated. In the case of the Golden Globes, that might not be quite true after a much-covered scandal that drove the show off television earlier this year, but in terms of usefulness, its populist choices do provide an element of cover for an Oscar telecast that's desperate to attract more viewers.

TITLE: US lawmakers set to grill Sam Bankman-Fried on the collapse of FTX
SUMMARY: With his vast crypto empire in ruins, Sam Bankman-Fried is preparing to be grilled by US lawmakers who are demanding answers about how his digital asset exchange, FTX, came unraveled, leaving at least a million customers unable to access their funds.

TITLE: US government budget deficit increased in November
SUMMARY: The US government recorded a monthly budget deficit of $249 billion in November, a 30% increase from a year earlier amid increased spending and falling revenue, the Treasury Department reported Monday.

TITLE: House Democrats have former President Donald Trump's tax returns. But what happens next?
SUMMARY: After a years-long fight, House Democrats finally have access to six years of former President Donald Trump's tax returns. It is now up to Ways and Means Committee Chairman Richard Neal to decide what to do with them.

TITLE: Richmond is removing its last remaining Confederate statue
SUMMARY: The city of Richmond, Virginia, started removing its last standing Confederate monument on Monday.

TITLE: ABC News boss confirms 'GMA3' anchors are subject to internal probe after being pulled from air
SUMMARY: "GMA3" co-anchors T.J. Holmes and Amy Robach will "remain off-air pending the completion of an internal review," ABC News President Kim Godwin disclosed to network employees in a memo Monday morning.

TITLE: Treasury Secretary Yellen predicts major inflation cooldown in 2023
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is striking a cautiously optimistic tone about 2023, predicting a major inflation cooldown and stressing that a recession isn't required to get prices back under control.

TITLE: Trump to release 'book of letters' next year amid 2024 campaign
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump is planning to release a book next year showcasing his private correspondence with past and present celebrities and international icons, CNN has learned.

TITLE: Starving bees are robbing hives as their keepers try everything to save them
SUMMARY: Hurricane Ian drowned so many bees and destroyed so many blooms that beekeepers are using emergency measures to try to help next year's produce harvests.

TITLE: Congress faces looming government shutdown deadline at end of the week
SUMMARY: Lawmakers face a Friday midnight deadline when government funding is set to expire -- and the House and Senate are expected to pass a short-term extension to avert a shutdown, which would give negotiators more time to try to secure a broader full-year funding deal.

TITLE: Twitter adds gold check marks as it readies relaunch of option to pay for verified accounts
SUMMARY: Twitter on Monday expanded its verification system beyond its signature blue check marks, with new colors for different types of notable accounts. The move comes ahead of a planned relaunch on Monday of the company's updated subscription service that allows users to pay for verification.

SUMMARY: Almost three and half decades since Pan Am flight 103 was brought down, killing 270 people, US officials have arrested one of the authors of the deadly attack, which was carried out by Moammar Gadhafi and his intelligence officials. TITLE: Appeals court weighs DOJ's use of obstruction charge in January 6 Capitol rioter cases

TITLE: Terrorism and War-Related Airplane Crashes Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Terrorism and War-Related Airplane Crashes Fast Facts and learn more about aviation disasters caused by military acts or by terrorism.

TITLE: Subaru recalling 270,000 SUVs due to fire risk
SUMMARY: Subaru is recalling 271,694 SUVs because some of them could catch fire.

SUMMARY: The US Air Force carried out the first successful test of its complete air launched hypersonic missile, the Air Force said in a statement, a program that had previously suffered a series of setbacks because of testing failures.

SUMMARY: Biden administration officials met virtually on Monday with Elizabeth Whelan, whose brother Paul Whelan remains detained in Russia, to discuss "next steps of the strategy" to bring him home.

TITLE: Supreme Court declines to block California's ban on flavored cigarettes
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court on Monday denied a request from tobacco company R.J. Reynolds to challenge a California law that bans the sale of flavored cigarettes.

TITLE: It's supposed to be the most wonderful time of the year. Not for investors
SUMMARY: The holidays are meant to be the most wonderful time of the year. But for investors, this week just might be the most stressful time of the year.

TITLE: Leaving his life in Bakhmut had seemed impossible. Now he's lost a friend, a limb and a livelihood
SUMMARY: The streets outside Vyacheslav Tarasov's home on Ukraine's eastern frontline are pocked by shell blasts. The buildings around are mostly empty, windowless and cold.

TITLE: Lawmakers should prepare for one-week funding stopgap as negotiations continue, Schumer says
SUMMARY: The House and Senate are expected to pass a short-term extension to avert a shutdown, which would give negotiators more time to try to secure a broader full-year funding deal.

TITLE: Railroad workers hopeful Biden will act to give workers paid sick time
SUMMARY: Railroad workers may yet get the paid sick days that were at the heart of their threat to go on strike -- if the Biden Administration steps in with an executive order.

TITLE: El Paso faced a 'major surge in illegal crossings' over the weekend, senior border official says
SUMMARY: More than 2,400 migrants crossed into the United States near El Paso, Texas, daily over the weekend, according to a senior Border Patrol official, marking what he described as a "major surge in illegal crossings" in the region.

TITLE: Tesla: Our 'failure' to make actual self-driving cars 'is not fraud'
SUMMARY: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said numerous times since 2015 that Tesla cars would be entirely self-driving in two years, or less. But years after his self-imposed deadlines have blown by, it still hasn't happened. Even when equipped with a $15,000 technology package that is literally called "Full Self Driving Capability," a Tesla car can't actually drive by itself.

TITLE: The latest on the Lockerbie bombing suspect in US custody
SUMMARY: A Libyan man accused of being involved in making the bomb that destroyed Pan Am flight 103 in December 1988 made his first court appearance Monday after authorities announced Sunday that he was taken into US custody.

TITLE: Former top Twitter official forced to leave home due to threats amid 'Twitter Files' release
SUMMARY: Twitter's former head of trust and safety has fled his home due to an escalation in threats resulting from Elon Musk's campaign of criticism against him, a person familiar with the matter told CNN on Monday.

TITLE: Peru's president asks Congress to bring elections forward amid protests
SUMMARY: Peru's new President Dina Boluarte has proposed bringing general elections forward two years to April 2024, during a televised speech delivered early Monday morning, amid ongoing protests throughout the country.

TITLE: Supreme Court resurrects pre-pandemic tradition: announcing opinions from bench
SUMMARY: The US Supreme Court announced Monday that it will resume announcing its opinions in person from the bench -- a tradition that was suspended during the Covid-19 pandemic, when decisions were simply posted on the court's website.

TITLE: What could be in store for 'The White Lotus' Season 3
SUMMARY: If you've been part of the cultural moment that is "The White Lotus," you've most probably inhaled this weekend's Season 2 finale already and are eager for any details on the third installment of the HBO series.

TITLE: French prosecutor investigating disappearance of New York college student studying in France
SUMMARY: A prosecutor in France has opened an investigation into the disappearance of an American college student who, his family says, has not been heard from in more than two weeks.

TITLE: Alicia Keys debuts her first holiday album and says she'd love to collaborate with Mariah Carey
SUMMARY: Alicia Keys is giving you the holiday classics with a twist.

TITLE: Russia's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces will resume "active counteroffensive actions" when the ground freezes, making it easier to transport equipment, Kyiv's defense minister said. Follow live updates here.

SUMMARY: Twitter on Monday relaunched an option for users who pay for its subscription service to receive a coveted "blue check," one month after the company was forced to pull the feature amid a wave of "verified" accounts pretending to be brands and high-profile users.

SUMMARY: A Texas man charged in the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol pleaded guilty Monday to threatening Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on Twitter shortly after the riot.

TITLE: Congress has so much to do before Christmas
SUMMARY: It is the most productive time of year on Capitol Hill -- after the election and before Republicans take over the House -- when the current Congress tries to cram in some of its most vital work into a few short weeks. Here's what to watch for in the twilight of 2022.

TITLE: Today's news in 10 minutes
SUMMARY: December 13, 2022

TITLE: Railroad unions hopeful Biden will act to give workers paid sick time
SUMMARY: Railroad workers could get the paid sick days that were at the heart of their threat to go on strike -- if the Biden administration steps in with an executive order.

TITLE: Lockerbie bombing suspect makes first court appearance in DC federal court
SUMMARY: A Libyan man accused of being involved in making the bomb that destroyed Pan Am flight 103 over the town of Lockerbie in Scotland in December 1988 made an initial court appearance Monday in a federal court in Washington, DC, where he was formally charged in connection with the terrorist attack.

SUMMARY: Lionel Messi is just two matches away from World Cup glory but his Argentina side must first find a way past Croatia at the Lusail Stadium on Tuesday.

SUMMARY: Fresh off her elated return to the US after months in Russian custody, two-time Olympic gold medalist Brittney Griner is back on a basketball court.

SUMMARY: It's a sequel 13 years in the making, but James Cameron will have to sit the premiere out.

SUMMARY: It's a huge bombshell with stunning revelations. Or is it?

SUMMARY: Special counsel Jack Smith has subpoenaed Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger as part of the Justice Department's investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election and the US Capitol attack on January 6, 2021.

SUMMARY: Donald Trump is heading for a period of maximum legal and political risk over his role in the US Capitol insurrection and hoarding of classified documents that will collide with his efforts to electrify a low wattage 2024 White House bid.

SUMMARY: Kevin Ware Jr. pleaded guilty to drugs and weapons charges on Monday.
